how i can restore partitions on a HDD un: from a backup? when they've been destroyed?
... so, it sounds like your hard disk is starting to die, or has died.
have you made *any* changes to it of *any* sort before this happened?
if you run 'sudo fdisk -ls /dev/hda', does it find any partitions?
Unless you are incredibly, incredibly lucky... your disk is dead. Ship it out to a data recovery service if you absolutely must have the data back.
be aware that will cost, though
right. Sounds dead. You can check it out in another OS just to be sure, though
it is *just* this side of possible that there's some bug in the kernel ubuntu is using - but I really doubt it.
unless you can pay for data recovery, forget it.
is there a easy way how to mount it as a loop device ?
you dd the data from the device file, then mount that as a loop device - 'sudo dd if=/dev/hda of=disk_image bs=8192' would do it.
however, as you said you get errors... it's hugely unlikely to work
it's dead. Get a new one.
